title: Dialogue in Resonance: An Interactive Music Piece for Piano and Real-Time Automatic Transcription System
author: Hayeon Bang (Graduate School of Culture Technology, KAIST), Taegyun Kwon (Graduate School of Culture Technology, KAIST), Juhan Nam (Graduate School of Culture Technology, KAIST), ...
relevance_why: The paper's exploration of real-time automatic music transcription using deep learning models may inform similar approaches in audio generation tasks, linking to Haohe Liu's research on audio processing.
background: Creating an interactive music piece where a human pianist and a computer-controlled piano communicate musically in real-time using transcription technology.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel framework that combines structured composition with live interaction through automatic music transcription, achieving a dynamic musical dialogue.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous interactive systems predominantly focused on either improvisation or prescribed scores but lacked a balance of both.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work uniquely integrates real-time transcription with a structured compositional approach, allowing an automated system to respond meaningfully in a live performance.

key_innovation: Utilizes real-time automatic music transcription to foster interactive dialogue between a human pianist and a computer-controlled piano, blurring lines between performer and machine.
real_world_impact: This application of real-time transcription may influence future collaborative music systems and enhance performances by allowing greater expressive potential.
limitations: The paper does not mention significant limitations but cites challenges with transcription accuracy in certain acoustic environments.

new_terms.automatic music transcription: **Automatic Music Transcription (AMT)** is the process of converting audio recordings of musical performance into a symbolic representation, typically MIDI, capturing note timing and velocity.
new_terms.Disklavier: **Disklavier** is a brand of player piano designed to play back recorded performances of both acoustic and digital sources, equipped with MIDI capabilities.

open_sourcing: A performance video, along with the score and system demonstration, is accessible at the web demo.
